name: barrenness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the state of not being able to produce plants or fruit: A short drive through the countryside reveals vast swathes of barrenness. The city gives way to sprawling ranchos, then barrenness. Synonyms
bleakness
desolation (EMPTINESS)
grimness (UGLINESS)
starkness
the condition of not being able to have children or young animals: Infertility treatment promises to overcome barrenness.
the fact of being empty or without anything new or creative: He dreaded a life of barrenness and isolation. All his talent can't disguise the barrenness of the screenplay. See
barren
More examplesFewer examplesThe region's many lush golf courses and resort water attractions belie the myth of barrenness. He explained that their parents had taken their barrenness as a sign that the union was not meant to be and had pressured them to divorce. You don't have to want to be pregnant to feel wistful at even temporary evidence of barrennessThe exhibited prints serve as a reminder of the barrenness of the museum's sculpture garden before it was landscaped.After a couple of years of creative barrenness, a raft of popular new dramas appeared.
